intro: Sticherus rubiginosus, commonly known as the rusty sticherus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, leafy plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant features elongated, thin leaves with a distinctive reddish or rust-colored appearance, which gives it its common name. It is characterized by its simple, dichotomous branching pattern and the presence of specialized structures called gemmae. Sticherus rubiginosus plays a role in soil stabilization and serves as a habitat for various microorganisms.
